title: Door Beneath the Needle
description: The Cartographer’s Needle rises from the basalt flats like a commandment cast before the city was born, its slate-black faces crosshatched in lattices that hum in sympathy with Marrowgate’s seven ribs at the knife-edge of dawn. Frost halos the etchings where the night’s last breath clings, and the wind here does not blow so much as point, turning every hair on the skin into a compass that distrusts itself. With Nalai Thread’s nervous curiosity flickering in quick glances and Lysa’s distant blessing inked upon a folded writ, Iriel draws the Fourth-Rib Bone Flute and coaxes a tone that is less played than revealed, a chord that folds the air like a closing ledger. A seam awakens in the Needle’s shadow and exhales the dry dust of roads-that-could-be, and with it the thin, flitting motes of stone-sprites that behave like doubts given thumbnail bodies. Within waits an archive that reconfigures with every breath, maps redrawing their arteries as if the world is a body deciding which limbs to keep and which to numb until council will and moon’s pull concur. Paths blossom, retract, and rebraid in a logic that can be felt in bone but not trusted by eyes, while harmonics from hidden chambers tap at the ear like lock-keepers knocking codes upon pressure tubes. At the archive’s heart a resonant slab displays three loci pulsing in sympathy—beneath Skull Keep in a sumped vault of relic-silt, at the Wyrmwell where a cartilage gate once sang back to Iriel, and in the Skyfall Shardfield where a broken ring of fallen crown still stains the steppe with cold fire. The Needle’s voice is not a voice but a certainty, a verdict that settles into marrow: something is threading old routes with a new design, and if left unchecked those routes will carry a will that is not the city’s. To leave with the truth intact, Iriel must play the dawn-tone that opens, navigate without surrendering direction to the thieving sprites, recover the Resonance Map and stamp its key onto star-glass, then shepherd Nalai and their fevered notes back across the flats before the harmonics change their minds.
objectives: Use the Fourth-Rib Bone Flute at the Needle at true dawn to reveal the hidden door without breaking taboo or tone.
Navigate the archive of roads-that-could-be while resisting the stone-sprites that try to steal direction and certainty.
Recover the Resonance Map and imprint its key tone onto a tempered star-glass fork so the Needle’s pitch can be carried.
Safely escort Nalai Thread back toward Marrowgate with notes intact, ensuring the findings survive breath, doubt, and dusk.

dialogue.speaker: Lysa Truin
dialogue.lines: Iriel, I am lending you my seal not because the Council permits it, but because the city needs a language for the argument it has with itself. The Needle converses in conditions, and if you listen carefully it will tell you what must be true before anything else can be attempted; that is how old instruments keep young cities from lying to their bones. You will be tempted to prove you are braver than a map, but I ask instead that you be more patient than a ledger, and more honest than a bell that rings for show. Remember that Nalai is your second set of eyes and your first witness; if something is learned and no witness remains, the Loom will say it was never known at all. Bring me a tone we can teach to the Sluiceworks and the Cathedral both, and bring me the two of you unbroken, because a discovery that costs us people is a debt the Collegium refuses to carry.

dialogue.speaker: Nalai Thread
dialogue.lines: The Needle is louder than any ledger, and yet somehow more polite, as if it is holding the door for our ignorance while we stumble through and pretend we meant it. Hear how it names things without saying them—my aunt always said the Loom does that, but this is different, as if the earth itself is embarrassed to speak and lets the stone do the talking. If these maps decide we should be roads, will we be paved smooth and walked upon until our names wear off, or will we be left full of potholes where stories collect like rain in old steps. I am not sure I was meant to see the world pacing itself into ifs and thens, but now that I do, I can’t imagine living with a map that never changes its mind. Hold my hand if the sprites blur the corners of my thoughts; I will count my breaths aloud like stitches, and you can tell me when the fabric pulls tight.

dialogue.speaker: Iriel Vask
dialogue.lines: Hold to my voice and keep your palm against the satchel strap when the lines begin to walk, because what walks can decide to leave us behind. The sprites steal direction, not courage, so if you doubt, speak a number that matters to you—four for the rib, seven for the districts, three for the loci—and then step where the hum is thickest. The map knows where the city bleeds and where it breathes—Skull Keep’s sumped vault, the Wyrmwell’s cartilage gate that once sang us back, and Skyfall’s broken ring where a fallen crown still rings at dusk. It’s telling us that routes beneath us are being tuned by a hand that remembers old emergencies and prefers their clarity to our compromises, and that hand is trying to make our future walk like a rescue drill. We will take the map and its tone like water from a guarded cistern, and we will bring them home without letting the taste of power make us thirsty for more than the city can drink.

dialogue.speaker: Stone-Sprite (whisper)
dialogue.lines: Lose your left and you will find your right, for what is balance except the relief of surrender. Give up your name and you will never be lost again, because nothing that does not exist ever wanders from itself. Take a road that is not there, and you will arrive at a place that does not exist and never leave, which is a kind of safety only the foolish and the free can share. We are only doubts with pebbled wings, little kindlings of maybe, and yet we can rearrange a promise if you let us breathe upon it. Let us drink your certainty and we will show you how light your bones can feel when they stop pretending to be a cage.

dialogue.speaker: The Needle’s Certainty
dialogue.lines: At dawn I do not sing; I reconcile, and the ribs of the city answer because they would rather hum than crack. Three places bend toward each other as if remembering a vow: the skull that counts, the gate that refuses, and the ring that fell like a verdict and did not break enough. Routes that should be seasonal are being made perennial, and the tide of council will that should wax and wane is being nailed to a constant by hands that fear floods more than they love rivers. If you take my tone and carry it, do so as a physician carries a blade; cut with it only where rot hides, and never where a scar is the city’s only truth. Leave no name behind you in this place, for the maps here are hungry and they chew identity into directions.

dialogue.speaker: Iriel Vask
dialogue.lines: No bargains with echoes, and no trades with sprites that want to drink the part of you that knows where home is; we will keep our names sewn tight. We take the map, we take the tone, and we take our feet out by the same seam we entered, even if the seam tries to pretend it has never met us. If the city’s bones must argue with the sky’s fallen glass, we will bring them a language they can both survive, a pitch that neither drowns truth nor shatters it. Nalai, if your thoughts begin to tilt, say the salt-tithe verse, and I will answer with the sluice hymn until the vertigo learns its place. And when we return, we will place this knowledge between the Cathedral and the Sluiceworks like a bridge—walkable, watched, and unwilling to choose a side until the city itself decides.

choices.title: Bind Direction with Ash-Cords
choices.text: Iriel knots the Warden Cords around wrist and satchel, then loops them to Nalai’s belt so that purpose itself becomes a tether. The Green-Shutter Lantern is cupped low, its muted flame strobing the frost-script on the Needle’s base so that each step can be sworn to before it is taken. As the archive redraws, Iriel taps a tempered fork to keep fourth-rib pitch in the chest, letting the hum settle like ballast in a riverboat. The sprites flutter close, pecking at doubt, but the cords drink their nibbling like wicks taking wax and give back only the faint sensation of being weighed rather than stolen. Progress is slow and deliberate, like writing a contract when both parties are trying not to be clever, and in that slowness a route appears that does not feel like a trick.
choices.outcome: The bound path holds true, and the pair traverse the archive with the careful gravity of oath-walkers who know there are witnesses in the walls. The cords pick up a dusting of fine grit that hums like a distant bell, and Iriel realizes it is the echo of the sumped vault under Skull Keep knocking back. Nalai’s notes are meticulous and whole, the script straighter than their hands feel, and the sprites—frustrated—content themselves with scraping the edges of ink like mice nibbling candle ends. At the heart-slab, the Resonance Map comes free without protest, and its tone imprints onto the star-glass fork with a vibration that crawls up the arm like relief. Leaving by the opened seam takes longer than entering, but the return path behaves like an honest ledger—no surprises, only the comfort of numbers that add up.

choices.title: Offer a Name-Decoy to the Sprites
choices.text: Iriel fashions a decoy from a blank ash-cord and a harmless alias whispered the way Grey Lanterns mask their couriers, giving the sprites a taste of a name that never belonged to flesh. The decoy flutters in their hands like a moth made of memory, and the stone-sprites swarm it in delighted greed, their whispering wings making the map-lines stutter and snag. With their hunger bent away, Iriel and Nalai move swiftly through the archive, stepping on harmonics rather than drawings, choosing turns by how the tones taste against the teeth. The risk is a private one: for a breath or three, even Iriel’s true name feels thin, as if a page has been torn from a ledger and the book does not yet know it is missing. Nalai squeezes Iriel’s elbow and mouths the Accords’ reminder—names are gifts, not bait—and the reminder steadies the air like a hand on a pendulum.
choices.outcome: Speed buys clarity, and the pair reach the heart-slab before the map can change its mind about arriving. The sprites, deceived, gnaw the decoy into agreeable crumbs that fall as lifeless grit, and their giggling recedes like a rumor finally bored of itself. The Resonance Map yields a brighter, sharper tone that stamps into star-glass with a quick, clean sting, as if the Needle approves of cunning so long as it is careful. On the way out, the archive tries one last feint, making the entrance look like an exit, but Iriel tastes the difference—a sweetness of elsewhere—and refuses it with a hum. Outside, breath comes back like a debt forgiven, and the alias drifts away as a harmless lie that harmed no one and saved more than time.

choices.title: Walk Blind with the Needle’s Hum
choices.text: Iriel closes their eyes and asks Nalai to count in fours, sevens, and threes, trusting the numbers to braid the city’s pattern into a rope. With sight denied, the ear rules, and the Needle’s certainty swells until it feels like a river against the ribs, steady and cold but merciful. Each footfall is placed by pitch alone, left for the low note of Skull Keep’s weight, right for the higher shine of Skyfall, step forward when the Wyrmwell’s remembered breath brushes the skin. The sprites try a subtler theft, seeding images that ache—a lamp on a childhood bridge, a ledger closed with a kiss of wax—but the rhythm edits the temptations out like a practiced scribe redacts a scandal. Nalai’s voice does not waver, and in its cadence Iriel hears the city’s own composure: frightened but disciplined, trembling but unwilling to spill.
choices.outcome: The blind walk teaches a secret the eyes could not have learned: the three loci are not merely destinations but syllables, and together they spell a warning that tastes of iron and rain. The Resonance Map accepts hands that arrive without the arrogance of sight, and the key tone takes to the star-glass fork with a resonance that continues to ring in the bones long after the fork falls silent. When Iriel opens their eyes, the seam is there, patient as a door at a patient court, and the outside air feels like a truth tested and allowed to stand. Nalai’s notes include not only lines and names but breath-marks, and later those marks will teach other ears how to cross by music in a place where drawings betray. The sprites keep their distance, wary of travelers who refuse the currency of vision, and the pair return with a quiet that is not emptiness but earned accord.

rewards.description: 500 experience for revealing the door, navigating the archive, claiming the Resonance Map, and returning with Nalai and notes intact.
Resonance Map of Roads-That-Could-Be, a living chart that redraws with council will and moon, anchored by the Needle’s tone.
Imprinted Star-Glass Fork (Needle Tone), a tempered fork that carries the Cartographer’s Needle’s key pitch for future harmonics.
0 chits; the Needle pays in certainties, not coins.
Grey Lanterns +1; word of disciplined discretion at Phosphor House travels in green flame.
Loom of Names +1; authenticated witness-returns and unbroken notes please the scribe-bank’s ledgers.
Pale Collegium +2; Lysa Truin’s faith is repaid with method, tone, and safe students.
